metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7178 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
CSRF was discovered in the web UI in Deluge before 1.3.14. The exploitationmethodology involves (1) hosting a crafted plugin that executes anarbitrary program from its __init__.py file and (2) causing the victim todownload, install, and enable this plugin.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

deluge - 1.3.15-2
deluge-common - 1.3.15-2
deluge-console - 1.3.15-2
deluge-gtk - 1.3.15-2
deluge-web - 1.3.15-2
deluged - 1.3.15-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: deluge package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.15-2').
